alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 04 at 10:03PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Snowmelt and additional rainfall to continue rises on many rivers and creeks in the region... River rises and increased flows will continue through the week as a result of snowmelt and rainfall through Saturday. Any thunderstorms that develop through Friday evening will be capable of producing heavy rain which may further accentuate the rising rivers. Isolated heavier showers or thunderstorms may also produce localized debris flows in steep terrain, especially near burn scars. Urban areas as well as locations with poor drainage will also be susceptible to flooding. Several rivers are forecast to reach bankfull by late Friday or this weekend. This includes the Moyie and Kootenai Rivers.
